trial_identification.studytitle: Randomised placebo controlled trial on the safety and efficacy of Biolane in osteoarthritis
trial_identification.scientifictitle: Randomised placebo controlled trial on the safety and efficacy of Biolane in osteoarthritis of the knees and/or hips

conditions.healthcondition: Osteoarthritis of the knees and/or hips

interventions.interventions: Biolane for a period of 18 weeks

primaryOutcome.outcome: Clinical outcomes will be assessed using the Western Ontario and McMaster Universities (WOMAC) OA index.
primaryOutcome.timepoint: WOMAC is measured at baseline and weeks 6, 12 and 18.

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Comprehensive Osteoarthritis Test (COAT) and Short Form-36.
Laboratory assays to assess fibrinolysis, coagulation, inflammation, cartilage synthesis and degradation and bone formation and resorption.

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: Total WOMAC score of >30 at baseline-x-ray and clinical evidence of osteoarthritis of the knees and/or hips.
eligibility.exclusivecriteria: Gout, rheumatoid arthritis or other inflammatory joint condition-Allergy to seafood or gelatine-Use of monoamine oxidase inhibitors-Use of corticosteroids within 4 weeks prior to baseline and throughout the study-Use of aspirin or anti-inflammatory agents 3 weeks prior to baseline and for the duration of the study-Use of complementary anti-arthritic medicines 6 weeks prior to baseline and for the duration of the study-Liver function tests greater then 3 times the upper limit of normal at baseline.

trial_design.concealment: Study medications supplied in numbered containers by the sponsor

ethicscommitee.ethicname: Australian Centre for Complementary Medicine Education and Research, Mater Health Services

contact.name: Dr Phillip Cheras
contact.address: Australian Centre for Complementary Medicine Education and Research (ACCMER) Level 2 Community Services Building Mater Health Services South Brisbane QLD 4101
